description: From German lauter (“pure, clear”, adjective). Began to become common in English in the 1880s.

examples: The practice in the Munich brewery made it plain that the object of the drawing off of the thick mash is to completely separate the thick mash from the lauter mash.

verbs.description: lauter (third-person singular simple present lauters, present participle lautering, simple past and past participle lautered)
